result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Probation in La Crosse Co case 13CF773, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain employment or undergo a course of education or a combination of both - def to work with PO
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with J.B. without approval of the PO
.

Participate in Cognitive Intervention as determined by the PO

Pay restitution and surcharge as shown in 13CF773

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
The defendant is to complete 5 hours of Community Service work each week - after  6 months the PO can determine if that should continue

Concurrent with 13CF773 (one-time only)
.
Concurrent with: 13CF773
.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with prison sentence in La Crosse Co case 13CF773 and also concurrent with any other sentence def is serving
.
